alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:44PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sequatchie, southwestern Bledsoe and north central Hamilton Counties through 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 343 PM EDT/243 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Dunlap, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dunlap, Soddy-Daisy, Sale Creek, Flat Top Mountain, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Palio, Mowbray Mountain, Brayton and Old Cumberland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
